We believe that our people are our business; so along with the tools and support you will need to get to where you want to go – we’ll make sure you have fun along the way! job.summary_external:
We’re looking for an experienced and enthusiastic Project Delivery and Improvement Manager to help build Social Work England.

You’ll have experience of successful project delivery to time, cost and quality, with excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate complex ideas, along with creative ability to help identify and drive improvements.

Working with the Head of Business Planning and Business Improvement Office, you will be leading a range of projects and improvements to enable us to deliver our aims and business objectives, playing a key role across the organisation at the beginning of our journey.
job.summary_internal:
We’re looking for an experienced and enthusiastic Project Delivery and Improvement Manager to help build Social Work England.

You’ll have experience of successful project delivery to time, cost and quality, with excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate complex ideas, along with creative ability to help identify and drive improvements.

Working with the Head of Business Planning and Business Improvement Office, you will be leading a range of projects and improvements to enable us to deliver our aims and business objectives, playing a key role across the organisation at the beginning of our journey.
job.main_responsibilities:
• Working with the Head of Project Management Office, leading a range of projects to enable us to deliver our operational aims and business objectives.
  • Directing, research and analysis to produce reports formulating appropriate recommendations and action plans within agreed parameters.
  • Playing a key role in developing our project management framework adhering to PMO standards/requirements.
  • Defining, scoping and delivering projects to meet project objectives to agreed time, cost, and quality criteria.
  • Identifying the impact of changes and inter-dependencies on existing systems, processes, future developments, and other projects within the wider organisation.
  • Producing and maintaining key project documentation in line with the project management framework and throughout the project lifecycle.
  • Providing clear and accurate briefing papers and other reports for the respective Project Boards, Senior Management and key stakeholders.
  • Tracking and managing project progress against project plans, manage issues, risks, change and costs for all allocated projects and regularly report to project sponsors, boards and key stakeholders
  • Developing effective working relationships with internal stakeholders and actively share information and knowledge across the organisation.
  • Demonstrating a commitment to achieving high standards and continuously seeking improvement.
  • Effectively managing project risks and issues and developing robust contingencies and countermeasures.
  • Critically evaluating and adapting service delivery to meet changing organisational needs.
  • Liaise with other parts of the organisation to develop innovative, timely and cost-effective solutions to organisational problems.
  • Ensuring a benefits-focused approach to project management
  • Conducting research to contribute to the development of strategic and delivery plans, programmes and projects.
  • Using research methods, process mapping, and recognised continuous improvement tools to understand problems and identify potential solutions.
job.ideal_candidate:
• Experience of successful project delivery to time, cost and quality
  • Excellent analytical, creative thinking and problem-solving skills.
  • Experience of developing project management frameworks and systems
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both oral and written including the ability to communicate complex ideas.
  • Excellent interpersonal and team working skills.
  • The ability to build and maintain strong stakeholder networks to deliver business objectives
  • Experience of managing change and making process and system improvements
  • The ability to produce and present complex information as understandable reports and advice relevant to the various audiences.
  • The ability to work autonomously and work on own initiative
  • A Demonstrable ability as a proven role model for respectful, open and honest behaviour including a demonstrable commitment to equality and diversity in service delivery.
  • A recognised project management accreditation or the ability to work towards a recognised qualification, such as Prince2 Practitioner.
  • A strong understanding of continuous improvement methodologies. A relevant qualification (e.g. Lean Six Sigma) would be desirable.
  • Experience of taking a benefits-led approach to organisational change, including experience of the use of cost-benefit analysis methods, benefit mapping and benefit profiling tools.

job.summary_external:
Recruitment consultants are responsible for attracting candidates for jobs and matching them to temporary or permanent positions with client companies. You'll build positive relationships in order to gain a better understanding of your clients' recruitment needs and requirements.

Working as a recruitment consultant, you'll attract candidates by drafting advertising copy for use in a range of media, as well as by networking, headhunting and through referrals. You'll screen candidates, interview them, run background checks and finally match them to their clients.

You also provide advice to both clients and candidates on salary levels, training requirements and career opportunities.
job.summary_internal:
Recruitment consultants are responsible for attracting candidates for jobs and matching them to temporary or permanent positions with client companies. You'll build positive relationships in order to gain a better understanding of your clients' recruitment needs and requirements.

Working as a recruitment consultant, you'll attract candidates by drafting advertising copy for use in a range of media, as well as by networking, headhunting and through referrals. You'll screen candidates, interview them, run background checks and finally match them to their clients.

You also provide advice to both clients and candidates on salary levels, training requirements and career opportunities.
job.main_responsibilities:
As a recruitment consultant, you're the vital link between clients and candidates. The role is demanding, diverse and involves:

  • using sales, business development, marketing techniques and networking to attract business from client companies
  • visiting clients to build and develop positive relationships with them
  • developing a good understanding of client companies, their industry, what they do, their work culture and environment
  • advertising vacancies by drafting and placing adverts in a range of media, such as newspapers, websites and magazines
  • using social media to advertise positions, attract candidates and build relationships
  • headhunting - identifying and approaching suitable candidates who may already be in work
  • using candidate databases to match the right person to the client's vacancy
  • receiving and reviewing applications, managing interviews and tests and creating a shortlist of candidates for the client
  • requesting references and checking the suitability of applicants before submitting their details to the client
  • briefing the candidate about the responsibilities, salary and benefits of the job in question
  • preparing CVs and correspondence to forward to clients regarding suitable applicants
  • organising interviews for candidates as requested by the client
  • informing candidates about the results of their interviews
  • negotiating pay and salary rates and finalising arrangements between client and candidates
  • offering advice to both clients and candidates on pay rates, training and career progression
  • working towards and exceeding targets that may relate to the number of candidates placed, a value to be billed to clients or business leads generated
  • reviewing recruitment policies to ensure the effectiveness of selection techniques and recruitment programmes.
job.ideal_candidate:
You will need to show evidence of the following:

  • excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • sales and negotiation skills
  • a goal-orientated approach to work
  • the ability to handle multiple priorities
  • problem-solving ability
  • the ability to meet deadlines and targets
  • ambition and the determination to succeed
  • tenacity
  • confidence and self-motivation
  • time management and organisational skills
  • team-working skills
  • creativity.

You must also enjoy working in a high-pressure environment and the responsibility that comes with it.
